intro.text: Now, four people entered a room
You are the perfect image of a perfect family
To this one on the wall
There is a table in the room too. and chairs. and a voice
The perfect family, on the wall, is in control
And you and me, we are both here to play along
Not as lovely as them, but almost. Almost good enough.
Seeing so many perfect families, makes your perspective
Is trying to be more like them

In this room, words are triggering words.
Tell me, what do you think the perfect family eats for dinner?
It is possible I didn't hear what you said.
But since dinner is getting cold
We are having roasted vegetables with rice.

triggers-gan.text: A family and a virus
Share many basic traits and qualities
Mimicry
Contagion
Repetition
Replication
Deception
They are both agents.
Systems that shape behaviors.
The effort of keeping it together, will inevitably end with an outbreak of reality
What you are not showing, will surface on its own
Like a family, a virus can crawl its way into the code, into the DNA, to your secret latent spaces
And change the basic meaning of you
In the end, how will you make sure something of you is left?
